availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Adelia Simmons. Father of Rufus Simmons, Mary Simmons, James Simmons, and Jennie Simmons. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Kenton County from 1853 to 1855. Attorney in Kenton County, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed Eliza McCracken as a domestic servant in Kenton County in 1860. Attorney in Kenton County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 4, p. 699.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 4, p. 235B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Kenton County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 210.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #12823.
John Boh, Wiggins' Kenton County Office Holders, 1776-1880's, (Covington, KY: Kenton County Historical Society, 1996), 19.
"Robert Simmons (1822-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial #92199797, accessed July 2, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/92199797/robert-simmons.
